|   | A polearm consisting of an axe blade topped with a spike, mounted on a long shaft.***"And Diarmid oh, Diarmid he perished in the strife; His head it was spiked upon a halberd high; His colours they were trampled: he had no chance at life If the Lord God Himself stood by!- Och ochone!" -James Clarence Mangan, \_A Farewell to Patrick Sarsfield, Earl of Lucan\_, ca. 1840 |

> This weapon falls into the [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") category. It is a two handed weapon.

The **halberd** is a two-handed polearm, the weakest but fastest of the bunch. It's a pretty decent weapon for both damage and speed when you haven't found a [shield](/Shield "Shield"), but you should upgrade to a one-hander or [glaive](/Glaive "Glaive") once you have trained some more skill.

As a chopping weapon, it'll cut off [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra") heads. It is also too large for [kobolds](/Kobold "Kobold") and [spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") to use at all.

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), [scythes](/Scythe "Scythe") had their own base type instead of being based off halberds.
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), these lacked innate [reaching](/Reaching "Reaching") and had a higher base delay.

Halberd

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Name Halberd
Skill Polearms
Damage 13
Accuracy -3
Base delay (%) 15 (150%)
Min delay 7 at skill 16
Hands 2H
Size Large
Ranged? No


A polearm consisting of an axe blade topped with a spike, mounted on a long shaft.

"And Diarmid oh, Diarmid he perished in the strife;
His head it was spiked upon a halberd high;
His colours they were trampled: he had no chance at life
If the Lord God Himself stood by!-
Och ochone!"
-James Clarence Mangan, _A Farewell to Patrick Sarsfield, Earl of Lucan_, ca. 1840

This weapon falls into the Polearms category. It is a two handed weapon.

The halberd is a two-handed polearm, the weakest but fastest of the bunch. It's a pretty decent weapon for both damage and speed when you haven't found a shield, but you should upgrade to a one-hander or glaive once you have trained some more skill.

As a chopping weapon, it'll cut off hydra heads. It is also too large for kobolds and spriggans to use at all.

History

  • Prior to 0.29, scythes had their own base type instead of being based off halberds.
